greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest number k such that k - d(k) = n, or 0 if no such number exists, where d(n) = the number of divisors of n (A000005).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10080
mathematica: Table[k = 2 n + 3; While[Nor[k - DivisorSigma[0, k] == n, k == 0], k--]; k, {n, 0, 99}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 29 2015 *)
xref: Cf. also A082284 (the smallest such number), A262511 (positions where these are equal and nonzero).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 28 2015
